Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: LHooten
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Catalonia Plaza Cataluna and I was amazed at the size of the room, the style of the lobby (classically European without being over the top) and the convenience to both Barcelona sites and parking. I would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ideal holiday hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: davaz
Reviews.Content: Rooms are comfortable and clean, very good breakfast, very good service, comfortable area, metro station just next to the hotel. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Crappy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eli S
Reviews.Content: I am writing you after having the most miserable experience in one of your hotels, a couple of days ago. This was my worst experience ever with any hotel in over 40 years of travelling. I booked with Agoda.com this 4* hotel, 2 rooms, for a nice vacation with my wife and my two young children. I chose this hotel since we wanted to be at the town centre and after seeing the "fantastic" reviews this hotel has received. We arrived on the 6th of April at about 2PM after over 5 hours flight from Tel-Aviv and were given two adjacent rooms 221 and 222. We walked into the rooms and I immediately realized those are not even resemble the rooms we have looked at the web page. Just a small window facing the sewer pipes of the entire building (photo enclosed). No air-condition and no ventilation. I immediately refused to accept the rooms and told the reservation manager, Adrian, the rooms are not acceptable. Adrian agreed that those are bad rooms, but he apologized that they are, that night, fully booked and that we will need to stay in those rooms only one of the four night. Adrian even suggested not to open our luggage, just for the night necessity, and that the next morning he will give us more adequate rooms. We were tired after the long journey and quite hungry, so we had no choice and accepted his offer. That was my biggest mistake!! We spent that night in those rooms and that was terrible. We could hardly get some sleep. We had to keep the window open to get some air, therefore we could hear every toilet flush during the night from all the rooms above us. I am not a tall man only 182cm tall but I couldn't stretch in bed since it was such a short bed. Next morning, first thing, I went to the reception to ask for the other rooms. Adrian was not there and the girl that was at the reception named Martha told me that Adrian went for vacation and didn't tell them to replace our rooms, just to try "if possible" and of course they are now fully booked and that they will not replace our rooms at all!!. needless to say that I felt cheated and humiliated!! Martha was the perfect girl to give us the bad news! I never encountered an hotel receptionist more unpleasant!! (I'm being polite) She said she will call Adrian and find out what he have promised us!! by noon she told me she have tried calling Adrian 3 times and that he is not responding his phone. I never heard such a ridiculous lie. I have tried getting a hold of Agoda by mail (enclosed) and by the 24 hour "service". I was very disappointed with Agoda for recommending that hotel to us, which looks nice and is very nicely located and I am sure they have some nice rooms as well, however "for some reason" Agoda customers are being accommodated in third class rooms!! The next 3 days were a disaster!! the bath tab would not flush and you couldn't take a shower. The dirt would come out of the pipes including cockroaches (see pictures). They sent 3 times a bell boy who tried to pump the sink with no success. We ended up taking all 4 of us the shower in the other room. The third night was the worst. It got hot and the air was not moving. We practically suffocated in our rooms. the only solution for some air was to open both the tiny window and the main door to the corridor to get some air circulated!! The light in the corridor all night and the noise from the toilets flushing all night were the least of our problems. At least we could get some air to breath!! That's how we spent the last two nights. Next morning my wife, after not sleeping all night, went down, crying, trying to talk to the hotel manager. He was not there!! so they told her. He was not there 4 days when we tried getting a hold of him. Adrian was there and even offered to replace one of the two rooms for the last night of our stay and even offer his "sympathy and understanding". Our dream vacation in Barcelona turned into a nightmare!! It was completely destroyed! I could not enjoy any more the beauty of this city. I was waiting for this to end and to be on the plain back!! Eli Shifman 20 hacarmel St. Hod-Hasharon 45221 Israel eli.shifman@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Very central and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: joliflor
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this very central Plaza chain hotel with a large group of friends with kids. The staff was very kind and helpful and ready to recommend restaurants beyond the touristy options, booking them over the phone for you. The couples with kids had larger superior double rooms for extra space for the additional bed and they were clean and comfortable, with a good-sized bathroom with all sorts of freebies, bath robes and slippers! The breakfast too was rich and varied and on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays it lasts until 11 o'clock. They really want you to feel on holiday! We were all very pleased also because it's so central you can get to many of Barcelona's most important sites just by walking from the hotel. Despite being in a side street just off Plaza Catalunya, the hotel is quiet and doesn't suffer from the traffic noise just a stone throw away. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bananya
Reviews.Content: As already mentioned, the location is fantastic. In addition, I must say breakfast was great and service was very good. The staff was really helpful and thoughtful. The room was ok, not a 4 star quality but really convenient and spacious.We traveled with a baby and the baby cot was really nice. Bottom line, we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for short stay”
Reviews.Author: alikat32
Reviews.Content: We just had one night and day so needed a hotel in a very central position. This was perfect as it is right by the aerobus stop and the tourist office at Plaza Catalunya. We also had no problem in walking back through Passeig De Gracia from Park Guell (with several stops on the way for beer and tapas) , and it was also an easy walk through the Barri Gotic to the port. Metro stop to Sagrada Familia just 2 mins walk away, so again very easy to get where we need to be without wasting too much of our very limited time. Tourist office were very helpful in suggesting the cheapest ticket for the metro and bus for our short trip. Reception staff very nice and friendly. On check out on Sunday morning we left our bag with them and were happy to leave passports etc in there as it was secure. We just collected everything at 7pm before getting the bus back to the airport. The room was quite large, with a seating area for two and also a corridor/dressing area between the room and the bathroom - so certainly not cramped as others have said. Fairly basic furnishings but the bed was comfortable and it was all very clean. Not luxury, but perfectly adequate for a short city cntre stay. Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice and again very friendly staff. All in all a good choice and would recommend to anyone wanting the best location with easy access to anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “very good location moderate comfort”
Reviews.Author: aktan76
Reviews.Content: exellent location for tourists, breakfats and rooms are moderate

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: tarkanlouise
Reviews.Content: I have just returned today from a 4 day city break to this hotel with my 10 year old son and husband. Let me start with the positives, of which there are many. The most important one is the location of this hotel which in my opinion cannot be surpassed. Excellent central location with everything you could need within short walking distance. The hotel is only 20 mins from the airport and cost us only 22 Euros by taxi. The hotel itself is impressive from the outside and that does not end when you enter the reception area, which is modern clean and inviting. The hotel is immaculately clean throughout and the reception staff were always happy to help and friendly. We were staying on a bed and breakfast basis and the breakfast selection was great and had enough choices to keep even the most demanding guests happy. Even though the hotel is on one of the busiest streets in Barcelona, the rooms were very quiet. The only negative was the room. Although immaculately clean, it was very cramped and very tired looking. I have stayed in many city hotels and this one was definitely struggling to be that of a 3 star hotel and not a 4 star. We were also disappointed that the extra bed placed in the room was very small and for the amount of money paid, would have expected better. We arrived at the hotel early before check in and were offered early check in for 10 euros, which I thought was very reasonable and suited us immensely as we were able to drop our bags and head out straight away. Over all, we were very comfortable in this hotel and couldn't have been happier with the location, however, the room did let us down and hope that this is an improvement the hotel will work on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for short stay in Barcelona, Spain”
Reviews.Author: LENMIRI
Reviews.Content: As a mature couple, we were extremely happy with our decision to stay at this hotel, mainly because of the excellent position (right next to the Plaza Catalonia - which is excellently situated for travel within the city - being right next to the Metro and close to many bus routes used for touring the city. The room was large and well appointed, and the heating worked very well during the very cold weather we experienced during February (about 6 degrees). There are many places to eat within a 5 minute walk from the hotel, so we ate almost all our meals out of the hotel to try and keep down costs. We definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Barcelona service”
Reviews.Author: midsummersteam
Reviews.Content: Definitely a superb location, making it easy to walk to so many places - seafront, Picasso museum, Cathedral, Gothic quarter - as well as excellent access to tour buses, metro and shopping. The hotel appears to have been recently refubished and the lounge, breakfast room and the bar - this is tucked away a little, but was very comfortable - are all excellent. The restaurant's food was very good, but some softer lighting would have improved the overall experience. Breakfast was absolutely excellent. What really stood out was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, all of whom speak excellent English. The front desk, restaurant waiter, breakfast staff - lots of them - porters and room cleaner all appeared to really enjoy their jobs and were committed to excellent service. We had a twin bedded room on the front, which was well furnished and had an excellent bathroom, however the bed was too hard, an increasingly common fault in hotels nowadays, it appears. Overall this was an excellent choice for our four night stay with very good value for money delivered by a very committed team of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DANET65
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect - in a quiet street just steps away from Plaza Cataluna, which is the site for: the largest shopping centre Il Corte Ingles, airport express buses stop just in front of it, as well as the tourist buses.Short walk from the Rambla, the Gothic quarter and embankment. The staff is friendly, helpful, and English speaking (not always the case in Barcelona). I read complaints about bad sound insulation - however did not experience any noise - neither from the street, not from the neighbouring rooms. My room was on the 6th floor and had a terrace with two chairs and table (paid a little extra for an upgrade, which was worth it). The room is ok, better lighting and coffee maker would be welcomed. The bathroom is large and clean. Overall impression is that the hotel is in need for some renovation. The management is obviously thinking the same, because on the last day of my stay the works had started in the lobby - during one day it was repainted and the furniture was changed for a new set of sofas, arm chairs and coffee tables, which gave it a much nicer look. Breakfast was nice with plenty of choice. The only negative point was coffee - poured by the waiters from the pots, while in most hotels I stayed in Barcelona, there is a choice of good expresso, latte, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JCook1958
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. Fantastic location and wonderful breakfasts, very friendly staff and within easy reach of the Ramblas, tourist bus, restaurants and bars and the tourist information centre. However, the room and bathroom were small considering this is a 4 star hotel and no tea/coffee making factilities. Insulation between the rooms was poor and we were disturbed by early risers and constant running water from neighbouring showers/baths. However, the location made up for many of the shortcomings of the hotel and would therefore probably consider staying there again but check the room noise first.

Reviews.Title: “Amazed and Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Arnie270
Reviews.Content: Just returned after 4 nites and we are amazed that we had found negative comments about this hotel by others. We had an amazingly good experience. Nice sized room on the first floor - our daughter and 2 grandchildren had a room next door which was ample for 3! The rooms were opposite the pool and could be noisy in the summer. Location, staff and breakfast were excellent. A tip - The "Bar" on the first floor is on the way to the pool and as we were off season no one seemed to know it was there. It was a luxurious place to sit around with the family, playing games or planning our itinerary and we even found it a good alternative to generally overspriced desserts we found at restaurants. Coffee, Hot Chocolate and cakes were delicious and reasonable. One area that we feel could be improved was room lighting. It's nice having a reading chair in the room but there should also be a light close by. In addition increasing the wattage of the light over the bed would also have been beneficial. Can't say if it was "value for money" because it was included in a package.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: MazaFin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 200 meters from Ramblas. El Corte Ingles is very near. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect. And still it is on a quiet street. Room was not very big. Breakfast was nice with a lot of choices. Elevator is very slow so I suggest to take a room from lower floors so you can use stairs. The pool area was nice but water was cold. But it was November so who really cares. My only complaint is that the beds were quite worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: ossama
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights , wonderful location ,best for 1st time visitors to barcelona and convenient to start your exploration . public transportation is just round the corner , Metro , bus , bus touristic and Toursit information desk . The Rooms are fine , our room was a bit noisy because of the opposite building central A/c , our A/c was not working but we didnt bother because weather was fine however this affected room ventilation. Front office staff were not freindly at all , they didnt bother, tentativly serve and didnt speak good english. Breakfast buffet was good with lots of varities. Being a 4 star hotel and less than 4 star service they need to re-check their pricing policy given the fact that couple of opposite hotels offer same quality with less prices.

Reviews.Title: “Much too expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: steveojones
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, the staff are helpful (just as well as I had to be moved 3 times to get a room that wasnt 35 degrees C) but the food and room quality is very poor. If they cut their prices in half that would be fine, but to charge €150+ per night for intermitant WiFi, very poor room service and rooms that were too hot is unacceptable

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: DC_Suburbanite
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the hotel. The good points: great, absolutely great location. Room was clean. Bed quite comfortable. Solveig, a young woman at front desk, was very friendly and helpful. When I asked for a restaurant's phone number, she voluntarily went one step beyond and made the reservation for us. Breakfast (not included in the price) is great, if a bit pricey (10E per person). Nice bathrooms, with nice shower head, and we even learned to appreciate the bidet...Clean air. We're subject to mold and asthma, but no problems at all in that regard...Nice outdoor pool area...Room had a litte table area in addition to the bedroom (not a big room by US standards, but big by European standards). The bad point: Although we didn't hear street noises, the noises from within the hotel were loud. Evey time someone closed a room door, it would make a loud bang and wake us up with a start, the whole place reverberates. Can also hear phones and conversations in the next room. We had room 415 not far from the elevator on the back side (nice view of the pool). But perhaps a room in one of the wings in the corner of the hotel on the street side would have not have broadcast the noises so loudly...The walls were cheap pine with the nail holes clearly visible. One pine board was warped and stuck out from the wall. Hotel does not have the amenities one would expect of a 4-star hotel (its advertised rating), a concierge for example, or WiFI, or newspapers. By US stds it's a clean and decent 3 star hotel. If you don't expect 4 star luxury, it's a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: BexxLondon
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel as part of group so didn't have any input into the choice but we were very happy with the result. The hotel's location cannot be bettered; most of the main sites are within walking distance. The room was spacious and very clean. I was glad to find that along with the air conditioning we could also open the french windows and watch life going on down below. The choice at breakfast is exhaustive and you would have to be extremely picky not to find something you enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal 4stars; with charm and historic touch. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Hedin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in three Barcelona hotels in one week. This one has been the best and I recommend it for city breaks, romantic escape, business trips and even grou trip (nice lounge with fine living room area). The two highlights to me are the very good service (they seemed to aim at my satisfaction and they exceeded expectations) and the charm of the old building -designed by a Gaudì's alumnus. I actually would suggest asking for a room in this wing of the Hotel: if you're after the early '900 spirit of Barcelona, this palace allows you inhabiting it. Nice breakfast and undoubtful cleanness. Safe area for later come backs. Right at metro, enough far from Rambla's mess.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location !!!!”
Reviews.Author: united357
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Catalonia Plaza Cataluna for 3 nights. This is a very good, luxurious hotel rite in the centre of Barcelona .The hotel staff at the reception was extremely helpful and co-operative. The room was clean spacious and comfortable. The breakfast spread was also very good ( charged at 10 euros per person). But the best part of this hotel is its location. The Aero bus from the airport stops rite in front of the hotel. The starting point of the Red & green Hop on Hop off bus is also opposite the hotel. Rambalas is also just around the corner. If you are coming to Barcelona for the first time you have to stay at Catalonia Plaza to experience all the action and wat better hotel then Catalonia Plaza Cataluna. Just one complaint. The safe box in the room came along with a lock and key and did not have an electronic lock. Hence had to take care of the keys all the time.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definetely be back”
Reviews.Author: OTlohja
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is ideal in Barcelona, 100 meters from Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla. The rooms are comfortable and quiet and nice.

Reviews.Title: “not a pleasent experience”
Reviews.Author: Romioo
Reviews.Content: the location might be the only positive point. however, we will not go there again due to several reasons. when we entered the hotel the guy at the reception did not welcom us at all and did not smile. he was barely listening to us. then we were guided to our room by a very nice young bell. here comes the worst part as the room is horrible very very small without any view. we returned to the same guy at the reception to complain but he didnt care at all and said that rooms with street view are all booked. he even left us without giving us any solution. then his colleague (a nice guy from asia) came to try to solve our problem and showed us another room but was terrible as well. we asked for the duty manager, they said he will come after 30 m; which we found very strange. AC at the reception was not working well and the elevatore without ventilation system. therefore we decide to go out searching for another hotel and a very good one very near called Catalonia Ramblas. we went back to check out and met the front office manager who listened to our complain and asked if we need any help to find another hotel. we told him we already did. he said that he will do us a favour as the two hotels are managed by one group, so the money we paid to our agent will be transfered to the new hotel and we will pay the difference as the new one is better. we considered this fair enough and we really appreciated such favor. but we could not forget the way we were treated by the receptiones, it was really bad. also, although the manager did such favour but he seemed not to be convinced, he talked to the manager at the other hotel in spanish infront of us and was laughing, which we did not consider nice.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER LOCATION; SUPER BREAKFASTS HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Globerunner7
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Barcelona, we wanted a hotel which was in a good location for touristy things yet quite quiet and we found it! The hotel is located on a side street less than a minute's walk to the Placa Catalunya which is an excellent location for the transport systems: the tourist sightseeing buses, metro and taxies. There are numerous resturants and small cafes and bars too for a relaxed nightlife. Yet, despite its close proximity, it was quiet and you didn't get disturbed by the hustle and bustle of the square. The hotel itself is clean and modern-ish, and the staff (for what we used them) were polite and helped as best they could. Our room was towards the back of the hotel with a view over the pool courtyard and the housing blocks behind it. The room was fairly small, the bathroom tired and in need of updating; but it was clean and good enough for what we used it for which is mainly washing and sleeping! The BREAKFAST IS A MUST! If you haven't already pre-booked it, it costs €10 pp/day but it is DEFINEITELY WORTH THE MONEY. There is a huge (and varied) choice of food and drink (including wine) which is all beautifully presented, which made you want to get out of bed for! In the buffet style, you could go and help yourself as many times as you wanted, and it was a good filling start to the day so you didnt have to stop to eat a snack until lateish (in true Catalan style!) . Brilliant and one of the best breakfast's we've had whilst away. The hotel is one of the few in Barca with a pool, and although space is precious in a city, we were disappointed with its size, compared to the large back courtyard in which it was set - more like a plunge pool than a swimming pool so if you like a good swim, this isn't the pool for you (unless you are prepared to do A LOT of two stroke legnths!!!!) All in all, a good place for B&B and somewhere to crash in the evenings. I would recommend it if you want a hotel with a good location for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Really Fabulous Hotel, Lousy Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Isobel C
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great four day visit to Barcelona and a wonderful time at this hotel. Wonderful location, beautiful hotel and great room. The only downside was CONTEMPS, the hotel restaurant which served up simply the worst meal I have ever been given at a restaurant in my life. While I appreciate that we wanted our dinner at what is an unearthly hour by Barcelona standards (6:30pm), that is no excuse for serving up chicken that is raw and bleeding on the inside. When we pointed this out, they simply whacked it in the microwave for a few minutes, making in even more inedible. That was then followed by a really gruesome 'Creme Catalan' (nothing like it should be!) I could have forgiven them if they had not then charged us 50E for that appalling meal and refused to offer any refund. Shame because the breakfast buffet was amazing. The staff was friendly and helpful and the bar staff very competent and efficient. Such a fantastic place - such a pity it was let down by the restaurant, otherwise our stay would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great breakfast, not so good room”
Reviews.Author: T_Belgique
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and I must say, its location can't be beat! The hotel looks great from the outside, however the lobby was dated and needs refurbishment. Front Office staff was unhelpful and not very friendly. We had to pick our own bags out of the storage room (so if we wanted to, we could take some extra bags with us). The first room I entered looked out on a narrow inner court, but there was a leak in the bathroom. So I had to go down and ask for another room, no excuses were made, nor any help was offered to help me move my bags. My new room was larger and had a small terrace with views over the pool. Although the bathroom was very clean, the room wasn't. There were signs of mold on one of the walls and the wallpaper was stapled to the wall. I was traveling with other people and their room seemed much cleaner, so perhaps I was just unlucky with this room. The pool area is nice and is a great welcome after a day of visiting the city. Breakfast was very extensive and everything was of great quality! The bar was good too and the bartender was very friendly. So in general, I had a good stay, but I didn't stay a long time in the room. And if I would visit barcelona once more, I am not sure yet if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “location location and location”
Reviews.Author: ramiAcreIsraell
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel in the middle of every thing. a minute walk to catalunia plaza and ramblas . very nice hotel very clean . we had the suit with a large terrace- very very nice and recommended to all. we will be back. the breakfast is very good and recommended- 10 euro in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: midwestgalOmaha
Reviews.Content: My daugter, sister and I stayed here for 4 nights in May. We loved the hotel and the location (right at the beginning of the Ramblas). The rooms were immaculate, modern, beds very comfortable, and the hotel staff was excellent. We enjoyed the balcony off the room (the three of us spent time each evening drinking some wine out there and people watching before leaving for dinner). We did not eat at the hotel (there are so many other places to eat that are less expensive and only a block or two from the hotel). We did spend some time at the bar and the staff were very friendly and service was also excellent. We would return to this hotel if we visited Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: BlackAcreSoDak
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the excellent hotel staff. We relied upon and received terrific and gracious help from the staff, especially from Oiana and Marta. Those two young women were really terrific. They helped us with dinner reservations, internet access, last minute transportation to the train station when our taxis did not arrive timely, and good advice on how to efficiently use the excellent subway system. We really appreciated their help. We visited this hotel with our young adult children and a couple of their friends, divided into three rooms. The deluxe rooms were fairly well appointed, although only typically sized for European standards, the bathrooms were spacious. There is a newer and older portion of this hotel. We were in the older side. It is served by a slow, single elevator. The top floor is probably ideal for quiet, but we often ended up walking up or down five flights of stairs because the elevator was nowhere to be seen. One reason we chose this hotel was the advertised availability of free internet. Among the six of us we had six devices to log into the internet. Unfortunately, on the top floor of the old section of the hotel (where we were all located), there was poor internet access. My computer could not hold a connection to the hotel internet while in our hotel room. We solved that problem by using our computers in the pleasant lobby of the hotel. Actually, several of us had difficulty logging onto the internet, but between Marta and Oiana, we all had access in a few minutes. Finally, we liked the location of the hotel, just beyond the Rambles. We were in close proximity to department stores and restaurants. In July, Barcelona is a busy place. This hotel is just barely out of the busiest areas of Barcelona. So, we could easily reach the mosh pit of Barcelona, or retreat out of it. We would stay at this hotel again, and if we did we did we would plan to rely on this excellent hotel staff again. It is the best reason to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable,”
Reviews.Author: roverix
Reviews.Content: Best location in Barcelonia - almost on Cataluna Plaza. This is the beginning of the Ramblas. One building away from the plaza so noise wasn't a problem. There is a small grocery store a couple of doors away (large bottle of water only .80 euros!) Modern rooms look like they were just redone and very nice bathrooms. The staff spoke excellant english and were very helpful. Good breakfast buffet and very good price on the room. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fully Enjoyed My Stay.”
Reviews.Author: winsomet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on Catalunya Square, so you have the best in terms of location. Attractions, shopping and everything is right within reach. All the major streets converge here, so you have easy access to any direction you choose to go. The bus to the airport is immediately across the square, so all you have to do is drag your suitcases and catch the bus, which runs very frequently. The hotel itself was also a good value. The breakfast was well stocked with many varieties to choose from, The staff was also helpful. If I ever return to Barcelona, this is exactly where I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: summerrhi
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Loved the location - it was easy to walk everywhere. The room was small, but nice and the bed was comfortable. It was also nice to have a balcony! The only weird thing was that if you shut the balcony door, that was your only source of outside light and there were no clocks in the room, so you kind of lost a sense of time! Unfortunately it was rainy on our trip so we missed out on using the pool, but it looked quite nice! Staff was helpful and friendly. We also ate at the restaurant one day, and that was great and fairly inexpensive. I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the best location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: patricia33487
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel. Best location. Cant get a better location than Plaza Cataluna. Very friendly and helpful staff, great food quality at the restaurant. The rooms were very comfortable, free Wi-Fi - not so common in Europe. Would definitley go back without a doubt. My kids felt at home !!!

Reviews.Title: “The grate service at your hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: motti_50
Reviews.Content: I came to your hotel on june 12th and i was very worried how will i manage beacouse i have a problem with my legg after an car accident i had. When i arrived at the recepsion was MARTA and she gave me right away the feeling that everything will be ok! She gave us room no. 124 that have a shower not abath so i will have no problem! She helped us in every thing we needed in our stay and made us feel realy at home!!! We want to thank her so much!!! Your hotel is so clean and beutifull and the staff is the best we mett! I'm sure we will come back and we would like allways to stay in room 124 please!!! With all our respect - Noga and Motti ARIELI - israel

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel, position ,amenties and great staff”
Reviews.Author: tigerbeer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice for a stay in Barcelona. it is 50m off Plaza Catalunya where the tourist buses leave from, the tourist office is and the Ramblas and many other important streets run of. It is a metro hub so easy transport around the city and there are shops very close, suppermarket and pharmacy below the big department store. The hotel was excellent, we arrived at 11am after long flight from Australia and our room was available , the air con was so cold we had to turn it down. There is a little noise from hallways but the room itself was so quiet. We overlooked the swimming pool which is amazing in the middle of Barcelona to have such a facility, It was well used every afternoon by guests. Breakfast was very good and the staff on the recetion desk were most helpful. We were on the 4th floor.We had free high speed internet 24 hours a day Decor and fitting were very high standard. We had five wonderful nights here and loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and mostly good service”
Reviews.Author: RLMCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. It is well located - within 1/2 block of the main square and La Rambla. The rooms are well appointed. The breakfast is plentiful and good. My main comment is that the temperature of the room was not bareable without the addition of a fan. Although the lobby and breakfast room were comfortable, the air conditioning in the room was virtually non-existent. Despite their attempts to fix it, their final answer was to indicate that we had north american standards that were not applicable to Spain. I don't accept the answer given that the business areas of the hotel were comfortable. Otherwise, this hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Switched”
Reviews.Content: We were transferred to this hotel after a reservation screwup at another hotel. It is a very good location, tho you might be "exposed" to a few street people. The front desk staff was excellent and answered all our questions. The hotel interior is very ornate and quaint. There is a very nice bar/tv watching area on the second floor. We had free WIFI, the rooms were very clean and the bathrooms of good size and decor and provided the usual accompanyments. We also had a nice balcony which allowed for some people watching. Fortunately, we were on the second floor as the balcony door would not lock. We reported it and someone came up to fix it and said he would be back but when we left it still had not been fixed. Unfortunately, we requested one queen size bed and got 2 smaller beds. Not sure if it is this hotel's fault as our reservation was transferred from another hotel tho. The bedroom itself was rather small, but not a big deal. After being transferred we were just happy to have a room.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nonna4ka
Reviews.Content: Well, I'll begin from positive side - the hotel has nice location, good breakfast, BUT the staff is horrible. When we arrived to the hotel, younge man was really nervious and demanded international credit card from us. Ok, I understand they need deposit, but the way they speak to you and his intonation "Ok, find somebody who can give credit card for you for deposit". And what if I'm travelling with cash? But it wasn't the main problem. They just ruined my first day stay with the room I recieved. The room in size of 2x2 meters. 4 stars hotel, not cheap, but as you open the door to the room - you fall on the bed. Small window with view of wall behind. I was shocked! May be it was stuff room they gave us, I don;t know. Sure we asked to change the room, but stuff from reception argued that it's what they have for this moment, it's standard room, however I saw other rooms, they are much bigger size. After all my shouts and tears, supervisor finally agreed to change the room THE NEXT day. So 1 night I haven't slept al all, the photos of this rooms are attached. Pay attention to the size of room. This behavior doesn't suit to hotel of this rate, may be for cheap hostel. No respect to visitors, no help. If you have small rooms like I recieved - make another price, don't say it's standard as it not, may be traveller who wants to save some euros, will buy it. The TV in the room is from past century, no tea/coffe in the room, safe box is for money. You can wait for elevator 10 minutes, as it works like turtle. The bathroom is good, clean and new, even in that small jail of the first day. You should make your choise by yourself, but I won't recommend this place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and charming hotel located in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: fujiyama123
Reviews.Content: We were a group of eight people and we all like it!!! A quiet little hotel in midtown The stuff was very nice, clean rooms and delicious breakfast with a great variety. Strongly recommended must go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: renapapanik
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5-day trip to Barcelona and after a long-long search (it was our first visit in Barcelona) we decided to stay in this hotel. Overall it is a very nice hotel, centrally located (best-best-best location anyone could ask) and anything you may need it is just 1 min. away from you (metro-bus-train station, even the bus from the airport "aerobus" leaves you almost right next to the hotel). The staff is friendly and helpful, we were given a room as soon as we arrived (10 o' clock in the morning) and that was fantastic because we were tired from the flight and so we didn't have to wait until 14:00. The room itself was great (although not very big), in the front facade of the building on the 5th floor, with a big balcony. Bathroom was also nice. The only con is that the bed was too short... Tip: If you want to have breakfast in the hotel do not book in advance. In the hotel costs 10 euros/person while in advance we would have paid 16 euros/person instead.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: IRH28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is placed at the centre of Barcelona just on the Placa de Catalunya, on the Rambla heading south to the port and adjacent to the very fashionable Quadrat d'Or. There is easy access to bars and restaurants just off the Rambla. Transport links are excellent as there is a Metro interchange in the square and the bus shuttle to and from the airport drops off and pick up in the Placa de Catalunya. The hotel is welcoming and the staff are excellent. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Best in everything”
Reviews.Author: Tsr69
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. We upgraded the room for 30 euro per night. We recoment this hotel in every aspect - location, very nice clerks, breakfast. Overall - best hotel to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: amertner
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be more central; literally next door to the central plaza. The rooms are clean and the staff friendly, and the breakfast is excellent - a great spread of local and international cuisine all prepared fresh and in plentiful supply. A welcome oasis to go to, amidst all of the mediocre or terrible restaurants around the center.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Break”
Reviews.Author: Cliff0
Reviews.Content: We wanted a relaxing few days sightseeing. This hotel is the PERFECT location, next to Pl. Catalunya and at the top of La Rambla. Our room was of a good size, super king size bed and an excellent bathroom. Breakfast was an extra €10 each and was really good value, setting us up for the day. The staff were a little overworked at breakfast but the service was fine. The day we arrived it was pouring with rain and we decided to eat in that evening. The restaurant was typical hotel, lacking atmosphere and had just a few other tables occupied., which was a pity. With linen table cloths, linen napkins, an adequate wine list and a 3 course menu at €17.95 it really is a hidden gem.....and the service was utterly faultless. In fact other restaurants we visited ought to send their staff there to see how good service can be.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: syt248
Reviews.Content: We loved it! we stayed for 4 nights, with my mother, brother and 2 teen aged kids. the location is great - just off Catalonia sq. and a no walk from La Rambla. Breakfast was very good - rich and tasty. rooms are clean and quiet - a nice ending to your endless walks through the city for the whole day. we didn't need the stuff's help, so I can't comment regarding this. I recommend it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nettup
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, perfect location, 5 steps from Piaza Catalonia. We had a corner room, with Parquet on the floor, very cozy. The staff speaks English and was very helpfull. Despite being clean, we had small ants in the room

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean and conviently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: DPAM
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - Good (Non-cramped) Breakfast facilities. Helpful and friendly staff. Hotel was clean and quiet at night. Good central location for Les Rambles. The heating did not work (Probably not usually needed) and as we were there in December it could have done with being a few degreews more. The Hotel said they had looked at it and sorted it but nothing chaged although we were only there for three days. The did waive the Safe fee so we were happy with the gusture.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - highly recommended for first time visitor”
Reviews.Author: ballista
Reviews.Content: this is my first visit to Barcelona. I spent in the hotel 3 nights and i was so happy with the hotel. each time i spent time in the room i was so happy with my selections. Pros: 1. Location- Best ever, the hotel is near plaza cataluyna so it's very quiet. 2. Rooms - very clean and new. 3. breakfast - doesn't matter if you arrive 5 before they suppose to closing time, they will keep filling out the food. 4.Room service is not expensive. 5. Internet work perfectly, i made all my phone calls via skype. Cons: 1.I asked several times for recommendation of what to do, didnt get a lot of cooperation (i speak Spanish so it wasn't the language) but I had the same issue in the tourist office. 2. the lobby is not very nice and look old fashioned (who care) To sum up, Best choice for first time visitor.

Reviews.Title: “More than just "location, location, location"”
Reviews.Author: trav_a_lot_10
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel as part of a vacation package, having some concerns following some bad feedbacks I've read. Every intimidating warning turned out to be false. My worries were for nothing. This is my fourth visit to Barcelona and Duques was the best hotel I've stayed in so far. Location is not its only virtue (and location was perfect). Breakfast was a good surprise, especially for our Mediterranean flavor. The staff was kind, helpful and Informative. The setting was appealing and there was no trace of noise or interruptions mentioned in previous feedbacks. The only shortcoming was the absence of a fitting room, and yet we were able to overcome this with a morning walk through the awakening streets of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, lovely staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: morrices
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and we would highly reecommend it. Staff were really friendly, room was great - no noise at all (Room 303) and the breakfast was fantastic - couldn't believe how much some people scoffed! The location is perfect for sightseeing and also it was only 1 minute walk from the airport bus. As a previous poster recommended it, we went to Reunion Cafe for dinner one night - again a great choice. This hotel is perfect for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast, great service”
Reviews.Author: The_Darlings
Reviews.Content: Great location, great breakfast, great service. Room was big enough for the baby cot, which was very nice. Only bad thing I can say is some bad odor in the bathroom, and sometimes unstable temperature of the water.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location bad room”
Reviews.Author: yuvaldy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in great location, however the first room they gave us (126) was very small, little double bed and the was a problem with noise inside the room from the water pipes (i could not sleep at night), when they gave us the room they said that it is for special guest ( i guess the gust they did not like). when we asked for a different room they said they have one but with 2 beds. the room was much better than the last one. 2 of the custom service persons did not treat us very well, i guess they don't like Israelis ( one of them is blond). the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous, friendly, and well-located hotel at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelG46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duques De Bergara hotel prior to, and immediately following a Mediterranean cruise out of Barcelona--4 nights in total, spent in two very clean and very comfortable rooms--one facing the pool and gardens on the 3rd floor, and one facing the street on the 5th floor. The hotel has a great location--next to Plaza de Catalunya and Las Ramblas. The staff was VERY friendly, especially Itziar (front desk) and Olga (reservations)...but also the other front desk staff, the bar staff, the porters, and the restaurant staff....every one. We were greeted with a smile, coupons for a free drink in the bar, and a large bottled water delivered to our room. Breakfasts were great, and the price was too. Oh yeah, and free wi-fi too!

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent hotel - go for it!”
Reviews.Author: pumiki27
Reviews.Content: We were 4 nights at the hotel mid-October. The hotel is located a minute walk from the Place de Catalunya. Simply excellent location, everything is around - buses, trains, metro, supermarket, restaurants, cafes, all you need within walking distance. 2 minutes from La Ramble. We got a lovely room, clean, with bath and balcony. Room facing the rear. The hotel service was excellent, every problem we had - was arranged immediately. Wonderful breakfast. Has everything - everyone will find something he loves. Selection of sausages, cheeses, eggs, Spanish omelette, bacon, sausages. Vegetables, pastries are baked the place itself, cereals, yogurts, jams, fresh orange juice - in short - did not stay hungry at all. The only thing you can say against the hotel - is the thin walls - as many have already noted about this hotel. Often - it's not so bothered us. But one night, apparently the people in the room next to us were talking (probably flew a night flight) and our city. Total - I highly recommend the hotel and definitely come back again if I get to be back in Barcelona. The hotel has a lovely swimming pool beside a bar, but we did not use it, because of the weather

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: HarveyCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Located on Plaza de Catalunya but facing a reasonably quiet street, which is perfect. Our room had a small balcony but no view as the wall was too high. Pity. The room was large and had a separate dressing/wardrobe area. It's quite an impersonal, corporate type hotel so don't expect any personal attention or friendly chatter. My big gripe is that they make you pay EUR 5 per day for using the safe in your room. It's already an expensive hotel and that should be a basic facility. They also charge you for using the hotel's computer to connect to the internet, which is a service other hotels happily provide free of charge. The evening we decided to go and have a drink at their bar, the door to the pool area was locked and there was no barman or any other patrons to be seen. Definitely not a homely type hotel, but nice and comfortable and clean and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very good breakfast but in need of better management”
Reviews.Author: jmk50_3
Reviews.Content: Based on the majority of very favorable reviews we decided to choose this hotel out of the list of still available options for our 5 day stay in Barcelona. Our family group consisted of my wife, me and our 3 children in their early twenties and the boyfriend of one of the girls. We got 3 rooms in 3 different parts of the hotel. Our room (#703) was on the 7th. floor (next to a suite) and was clearly one of the best standard rooms they have. A spacious bedroom with big terrace and bathroom with beautiful red marble walls. A pity the bathtub showed ugly signs of corrosion... Another room was on the 6th. floor and had an unsightly view of the small inner space between the 4 sides of that part of the building. The 3rd. room was not fit for occupation and we demanded to get another room which we got, but that one was not very clean. As there was no other room available, 2 of our kids had to sleep one night in a less than acceptable room. Breakfast was indeed very good as has been mentioned here by many others. Service was in most instances adequate although not more than that. If understaffed, full house or other reasons were behind this is for us as hotel guest irrelevant. Because location is really a very important issue when visiting Barcelona, this hotel still scores high in our recommendation. Being the most expensive hotel on the list of 4 stars hotels we were offered, we expected a little more service and amenities. Charging an extra 5 EUR per day for using the safe in the room, even with free WiFi Internet, did not make things better. The swimming pool is much smaller than it appears on the picture and was, on top of that, not particular clean. Maybe management is too complacent with so many positive reviews? Nevertheless, we had a great time in Barcelona and the Duques was certainly partly "responsible" for that......

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: j0hn1509
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights the staff are so nice one girl on the reception here name is itziar was so helpfull and charming to us. the hotel is in a prime spot for site seeing would go back again without thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bebo2603
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Bergara with my two year old daughter and my husband. It's location is great. Just at corner of the LA RAMLAS and only two minutes to hip hop bus stop. Service is very good. Always smiling and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: biggi7
Reviews.Content: + I found it great that the personal immediately noticed that I was travelling with my son and automatically arranged the sofa as an additional bed. + Our suitcases were automatically brought into the room while we were sightseeing. We had checked in early and the room had not been finished yet. We did not have to carry our cases to the room on returning later that day. + We stayed in a very spacious suite, although we had not reserved a suite. + The location was perfect. The hotel is very close to the centre of the town, but due to being in the side street, it was very quite. - On entering the room initially, the room was very hot, as the air conditioning only functions when the key was in the electricity on switch. Especially the air conditioning should be separated from the rest of the electrical circuit to ensure, that the room can cool down whilst one is not in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very clean, lovely pool, great staff”
Reviews.Author: kiwiok
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at this hotel. Went for city break in August, as we were on our wedding anniversary we were upgraded to a suite which was huge and really comfortable. All staff were very welcoming from the Manager to the cleaning staff, all very polite and helpful. Very clean and comfortable hotel which is a priority for me. Rooftop pool is lovely after a day's sightseeing, very tranquil with funky background music playing and you do feel you're miles from the hectic pace of Las Ramblas. It's not huge pool but I assume space is at a premiuim and I'd imagine most pools are small in the City. Try and get there early to get a sun lounger. Cocktails were fab. Great location just off Las Ramblas but in a quiet street. Very handy for shopping, sightseeing etc.... Other recommendations - Cafe Reunion - amazing food at incredible prices...seem to be mostly locals. Also, take red bus tour as oppose to green bus - no queues unlike the other that most Hotels reccommend. Pretty much same tour/same sights. Went to beach 2 days - lovely but busy. Barcelona is a great place for a city break with a difference - stunnning architecture. Don't go if you're looking for a lie on beach/sun lounger, do nothing all day holiday. Do go if you want great restaurants, shopping, funky bars, amazing architecture and history & plenty of fun. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: GalitSher
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice. Problems with closing the room door, you have to slam it, so in the night you can hear it from other rooms. Stuff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, quality traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: valentine66
Reviews.Content: Welcome stay , food excellent , particularly the buffet breakfast , the restaurant at the weekend is busy but quality menu. Competetively priced for such a quality hotel in the centre of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “The best location!”
Reviews.Author: Ninush
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel in December at Christmas so swimming pool area was closed and I can't comment on this. We just stared at it from our room. The room was very quiet and clean. There is a safe in the room and you have to pay for it if you want to use it. TV was old fashioned, not the flat one. The breakfast was repetitive but lovely. The main advantage of the hotel is it's gorgeous location. It is quiet and still in the very heart of Barcelona 3 min. walk to La Rambla, Plazza de Catalunia, shops, cafes etc. Very convenient! The staff members didn't speak fluent or understandable English.But you can get over it somehow. All in all it is a lovely hotel. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel , queit and clean”
Reviews.Author: assafstein
Reviews.Content: i've been there with my wife last week 1-7/8 the location is great near evrything few meters from the catalonya square and the rambla near graciya st. near the metro and the beach the breakfast is great. the aircondition is terrible but it didnt disturbed us to enjoy the vication. i'm realy reccomend this hotel Assaf Stein Isreal

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Great Pool and bar service!!! Guilliame is divine”
Reviews.Author: ady28
Reviews.Content: What a great location - across from Zara and all the major stores and best of all a beautiful pool with a lovely french barman and sunshine - does it get better? Rooms are ok - not glamourous - but sufficent really nice staff - and we enjoyed out stay very much

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet for the centre of Barcelona and most comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jsteel141
Reviews.Content: Staff at reception were polite but overstretched. The swimming pool and surround were most welcome in the heat but need a revamp. All other aspects excellent, fantastic breakfast. Our room ,level with the pool, was very quiet and convenient. Very well positioned for the Rambla, city tours and airport bus.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Service”
Reviews.Author: RMBenge34
Reviews.Content: Checked in yesterday, and rooms were not right for guaranteed reservation on my print out. Got three rooms air condition works great in one, poor in another and not at all in the third. complained to front desk this morning and was assured they would look into it. Got back from touring this evening to two rooms hotter than, well! Went to front desk and asked to see a manager, was told one is not available. Sent up service person (not air condition man) who fiddled with dials and said room would cool in ten minutes. Four hous later room is barely bearable thanks to opening window on busy street. Unbelievable, won't stay here again, won't rcommend anyone else stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: PWLBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff at the des and in the restuarant. Would definitely recommend this hotel for Both business and leisure. Extremely good locaion Especially getting in and out using the airport bus Which is only 1 minute walk away. The Ramblas is less Than a minute away. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: DASBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Warm, friendly, service-oriented. Just a few of the words to describe the staff at HOTEL DUQUES DE BERGARA. This centrally located, good quality hotel is a perfect fit for both personal and business needs. My company has had several important business meetings on the premises and my personal stays have been top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed to have missed you!”
Reviews.Author: dandms11
Reviews.Content: Having spent hours researching Barcelona Hotels, choosing this one, fighting through the Barcelona traffic to get there, struggling to reception with our bags only to be turned away as our Booking.com booking was not honoured, blaming their systems. On the credit side they sent us to a nearby sister hotel which was fine, but not what we wanted! All I can say is it looks good, good reviews, great location but suspect management!

Reviews.Title: “Great - have used twice and will use again!”
Reviews.Author: Gamida
Reviews.Content: Located within easy walking distance of centre. Clean, great service, easy to work with in preparation for meetings. Nice meeting rooms, good food.

Reviews.Title: “Maximum value to our money - thank's a lot”
Reviews.Author: shabat76
Reviews.Content: excellent service , excellent room and the best location. If i will go again to Barcelona, i will back to this hotel. you Should have a double bed not Separated thank you very much I will tell to my Israeli friead about your good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: _Le_nochka_F
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 days during a short break to Barcelona. The location of the place is perfect: close to underground, airport bus connection, touristic buses stops, thousand of nice shops and of course, La Rambla. Hotel is situated in one of the side streets of Pl.Catalunya. Our room at 6th floor had a reasonable size, beds were comfortable, everything clean. Very good breakfast, only coffee could be better. Staff was helpful and friendly, with the exception of one-2 receptionists (may be new or unexperienced), who were not exactly aware of the things they were doing. Overall, I am pleased with my stay at the hotel and will book it once again to my next trip to beautiful Barcelona-

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly hotel that takes advantage of tourists”
Reviews.Author: patschicagoIL
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel has clean large rooms, the front desk staff is extremely unpleasant. The hotel charges 5 Euros PER DAY to use the in room safe. This is outrageous and takes advantage of Barcelona and the Ramblas' reputation for having pickpockets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lcolbey
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group of 12 ladies. We had 6 rooms. Everyone agreed that this was a nice place to stay, and we couldn't ask for a better location. Just steps away from las ramblas. The room was large and clean. I have no complaints about the staff. We didn't ask much of them. Good breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “STAY ACROSS THE STREET AT THE HOTEL PULITZER INSTEAD!!”
Reviews.Author: nursely
Reviews.Content: NO! NO! NO! Got stuck in Barcelona and stayed here for two nights, checked out in disgust. NOT a 4 * by anyone's standards, this hotel doesn't know the meaning of service and is unfriendly, unhelpful and just plain nasty. Bathroom had 1/2 inch of mold in the shower, lousy towels and toiletries, ignored requests for extra pillows, no extras and noisy to boot. Internet is NOT free unless you have a wireless, they refused to print boarding passes or help us with any of our problems, which due to cancellations and delays, were numerous. Had stayed at the Hotel Pulitzer and went across the street for help, which they cheerfully and willingly gave. Don't even think about staying here unless you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, best location!”
Reviews.Author: shayzakai
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great place (near to La Rambla st.), the staff was very nice and helpful when we asked how to arrive for all kinds of places. Very recommended! Hotel e-mail: duques@hoteles-catalonia.es

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Charming, Quiet Respite In The City”
Reviews.Author: SuburbanWife
Reviews.Content: After enjoying a week at a nearby hotel, The Pulitzer, we moved to the Catalonia Duques because our current hotel was booked. We expected to be disappointed, but were extremely pleased with the Duques. The hotel has old school charm, is modernized, yet retains the original charm. The grand door (although hard to open) and marble stairs give you a glimpse of an era gone by. The rooms have been updated, and have what any traveler needs. Smallish by American standards, but with plenty of room truthfully. The bathrooms are large and the shower was excellent. We did not eat at the restaurant, but enjoyed the lounge very much. It is large, quiet and very inviting. We hosted a get together for 12 in the lounge, and the restaurant manager did a great job putting together appetizers for us. It was a great evening! The bonus about the Duques is the pool. I did not go to Barcelona to lounge by a courtyard pool, but it was a wonderful respite for our tired feet after a long day of exploring the city. This is not a suffy or fussy hotel where staff members bow to your every move. Personally, I find that type of property too formal and staff insincere. Here, staff are welcoming and professional. They give you what you need and are very nice. My one minor complaint would be some of the front desk staff, but even that seems a bit unfair. Their back office has the desk chairs and their computers facing away from the front desk, so they often do not see you. If all staff are working in the office, guests have to wait until they notice you, or give a little "Hello" to get noticed. This is a design and management flaw, but is quite minor overall. This small property has all you need and more, and is steps from the Plaza, Las Ramblas, the Gracia, buses and Metro. I highly recommend it! And be sure to have a mojito at the pool. It is a cool respite in the busy city!

Reviews.Title: “Good, city center hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: Spent just one night at the hotel but was quite impressed. Just yards from Plaza Catalonia and the Ramblas. High point is the pool and adjoining bar. Our room was a little small and with no view but we only booked on the day and the hotel was full. Very comfortable bed and good bathroom with a bath big enough to have a lie down in (more unusual than you would think in Barcelona. Staff were very nice and helpful, especially the bar staff. Recommended for a no frills couple of nights, especially for a shopping trip. If you have a choice stay in the 'old' part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: pabax
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading all the reviews i booked a room in this hotel - and it was well worth it! The location is absolutely wonderful, 10 seconds walking to the plaça catalunya (the beginning of 'Las Ramblas'). The hotel itself is quiet (it's not located on the main street), and the room we got was a Standard Double bed room with two very big beds connected. Breakfast is very varied: bacon, eggs, sausages, cereals, fruits, tuna, etc... Staff was very nice and helpful. Overall, we had a wonderful time in Barcelona and the hotel sure was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: whetstoner
Reviews.Content: What a hotel! A couple of hundred yards from Plaza Catalunya so relatively quiet, but a minute away from central Barcelona's attractions. Highly recommend taking a two day ticket on the open-topped tour buses; two separate routes covering all the sights, and hop on/hop off with never a more than five minute wait for the next one. Had lovely first floor rooms in the air-conditioned hotel, but the real bonus is the courtyard garden; cool, green, lovely furniture and loungers, a bar and a small swimming pool. Excellent breakfast - really fresh and good selection. Staff very friendly, smiling and helpful. Would definitely recommend and am already looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - but don't take a taxi from the airport!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui82
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a stay at this hotel. For a first visit to Barcelona the setting couldn't have been better. You are literally minutes away from the Placa de Catalunya but the good news is that as the hotel is on a side street there isn't much noise. My sister and I had booked a twin room and it was a good size, one minor niggle - there are no drawers in the room. There's a mini bar and no-one made a fuss when I put some of my own purchases in it. Room service prices are very reasonable but I didn't eat at the hotel. There are just so many other options. OK now the taxi bit. We foolishly took a taxi from the airport, forget the 25 euro mentioned in the guide book, the meter said 34 and he charged us 45. When we asked why he said he had charged us for lifting our 2 small cases into the boot. We had no option - we paid. We then discovered the aeroport bus stops at placa de catalunya, get off it, cross over to the other side, look for the Habitat, FMAC sign on the corner and on the other side you will see BBVC (?) a bank, a few doors down is the hotel. A single to the airport is 4.25. Apart from that we had a fabulous time. If you are doing the bus tour then buy the Bus Turistic pack from the hotel, it costs 4 euro but you get a 6 euro off the price of the tour and a discount pack and map. Buy this pack anyway and when you arrive, it saved us a fair bit of money. One word of caution, the prices to eat out are pretty good compared to london, dublin and certainly vilamoura, but the drink prices are the stinger. Two bacardi and cokes = 16 euro, stick with wine! Barcelona is amazing and I'll go back, and happily to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic end to our summer holidays”
Reviews.Author: OTlohja
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in CDBH and we can with full heart recommend the hotel due to its: location, rooms, breakfast, staff, atmosphere. One mionor minus is the rather small pool area and people "owning" the sun beds and towels (3 per person is too much) for too long time. OK, we did not come to the hotel to stay the afternoon by the pool side, there is always so much to see and do in Bcn. The room service surprised us with low prices.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location yet one con'”
Reviews.Author: JacobGalilee
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is Perfectly Located. The Breakfast is tasty and colorfull and the hotel decoration is charming. Our room was noisy, due to s pipe system that ran through one of it's walls, but the hotel stuff were kind to move us to a much convenient room. Yet one remark: I find it a little anoying that the guests are charged for Internet, while a some others Barcelona hotels offer a free wi-fi connection.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, best location, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: flydog1
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a week with a girlfriend - everything was wonderful except for a fact that they didn't have a double bed (there was an available room with one but an extremely small one) however as far as i understand the situation it's something very common to all spanish hotels - just put the beds together and the party's on. Location is brilliant, windows block all incoming noise. Breakfast was very nice - check out their desserts - delicious stuff, and coffee's the best ever. Most important lesson learned - do not get a hotel on La Rambla itself, it's fun to walk about but you wont like what's going down there late at night, unless u're up for some thrills and either looking to get into a fight, wanna get hooked with some dope or a wasted british teen.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for a Barca Stay. Don't think about it...JUST BOOK IT!”
Reviews.Author: Lexus Larry
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 night stay in Barcelona, and I have to say the Catalonia Duques de Bergara Hotel was an ideal base for our holiday. The hotel is located on a side street adjacent to Placa De Catalunya, right at the top of La Rambla and pretty much at the hub of everything. All tourist buses, main tourist information kiosks, and metros are to be found here, along with an infinite supply of cabs and the Airport Bus stop. You really couldn't get more central. The rooms were lovely, spotlessly clean, and plenty big enough. Our room (611) overlooked the pool area out the back, and was very quiet. Staff were very friendly, especially Miquel in the bar. He got our sense of humour, so we had a good bit of banter with him. Drinks were very reasonably priced. Can't really comment on the food, as we stayed "room only" and never ate in the hotel. An English couple we met had dinner in the restaurant, and they said it was beautiful. What I can say about the food is, the hotel were charging €15 per person for breakfast, which we thought was rather pricey. So every morning, we walked down to the corner of Placa De Catalunya to Café Zurich for breakfast. Two ham & cheese paninis and two fresh orange juices for the princely sum of €13. It's a great location to "people spot"...right at the top of La Rambla with a metro station next door. You could sit for hours in the sunshine watching people going by! This really is the ideal hotel for a trip to Barcelona, and when we go again, it's here we'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “a magnificent stay”
Reviews.Author: mobileworldcongress
Reviews.Content: An outstanding management combined with a very friendly staff at a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, excellent service, excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Avshu
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by our friends, and we were happy to find that it's indeed an excellent hotel. The location is absolutely perfect, it's a quiet hotel with a good service, and another advantage - a child under 12 years old can stay at the room for with no extra fee. I'll definitely return to this hotel on my future visits to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Food, Location, A Perfect Visit To Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Gill22
Reviews.Content: The airport bus transfer to our destination was so easy and a fraction of the cost of a taxi. It's well worth doing. We were relocated to this hotel Catalonia Duques De Bergara, from it's sister hotel Hotel Catalonia Ramblas, which was nearby and which exceeded all our expectations. The visit was planned to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday and was everything it could possibly be and more!! Excellent service, excellent location, excellent food, excellent surroundings. FANTASTIC!!!!!!" We visited an excellent tapas restaurant called Taller de Tapas Restaurant which served excellent food at reasonable prices with a great atmosphere. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. More details can be found on their website [-]." The touristic buses are "a must" when you visit Barcelona. You get to see all the sights with the option of stopping off to visit them and jumping back on the bus to continue your adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: SimoneEv
Reviews.Content: The kind of place where you stay because of location. Right in Plazza Catalonia and 3 min from Ramblas, metro. As the airport bus has it's terminal in Plazza Catalonia it also made for a cheap airport transfer. The lobby and corridors look pretty old and outdated. The concierge staff was alright, although they had a time-span of 1 min in their explanations after which they were moving on something else. Perhaps they were very busy. Breakfast was very good, the buffet is stored with little gourmet dishes which I thought was very thoughtfull trying to change a bit the American buffet routine. Also the service in the breakfast room was very good, fast and efficient. We've tried the bar at 1st floor one evening and it was awesome. The bartender will fix you a Sangria and will chat with you about Barcelona and Spain. He obviously likes to entertain. What I didn't like was the room. Old blankets, old furniture. Almost no decorations. It felt worse than IBIS. As it was pretty cold during the night, we had to stuff some bed covers on the windows side because of the cold coming from there. we had a room at pool level, basically there was a plant-fence in fron of us. What I did like in the room configuration was the door between the room and hall. It isolated the room from the noise. If I'll come back it will be for the location and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great value”
Reviews.Author: batw
Reviews.Content: Booked this last minute, to be honest, purely on discounted rate and location basis. Travelled with family group of 16 people, so cost was a factor, to keep everyone happy. Double rooms were 78 Euros, triple, 114 Euros. Staff were very pleasant and helpful and location was perfect for everything. Rear facing rooms overlook a small pool, unfortunately not heated in winter. Breakfast was good, at 15 Euros pp. On checking out a few of the other hotels we had been considering, this hotel was probably the best of the bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ggonzalez
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Everyone was happy to communicate in English. The hotel is located steps from the main city center which makes it great for sightseeing. The breakfast was delicous! Our room overlooked the pool and was clean and modern. Would recommend to anyone. If you've had a few too many sangrias just mention the name of the hotel to the cab driver. They all seemed to know where it was.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unpleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: LeekyWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights. The room was absolutely freezing and when I asked the reception staff for the heating to be put on she said no but she would send a blanket to my room (I already had two extra blankets!). The bath had not been cleaned and my friend had her bag stolen in the foyer right in front of the reception staff and she did nothing. She even wanted to charge my friend for the phonecall to the police!

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: siggih
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right off the Catalonia square, but when you enter it is completely calm and quiet, and the atmosphere is very relaxed and friendly. The service is excellent. Apart from outstanding accommodation this hotel is excellent for all kinds of parties and conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: embee52
Reviews.Content: We were not on the rooming list on arrival but that was presumably the fault of Expedia! Having said that got a good room next to the suites on the 7th floor. Large comfortable bed, good bathroom with plenty of towels, changed daily. Very good buffet breakfast, so fill yer boots! Location is terrific and staff were very pleasant. Just don't recognise the bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: WTLLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel foyer will give you a great impression, but for us it was all down hill from there. The hotel is run down by the standards set by its competitors at around the same price point, and the service is particularly lacking. Our room was shabby and had almost nil natural light. We packed up and moved across the road to The Pulitzer which was slightly more expensive but worlds apart in product and service.

Reviews.Title: “Family fun in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Lala0706
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 day break in Barcelona staying at Catalonia Duques De Bergara Hotel. The Hotel is cleaning a welcoming, Staff very friendly and efficent with checking in procedures. When booked i had asked for the two rooms to be next door to each other and also asked for a cot in one of the rooms the rooms were situated next door but one to each other and there was a cot in the double room complete with pillow and duvet. The Rooms We had two room one double and one twin, The room were clean and the bathroom was well stocked with complermenty toiletries on arrivle. The bed were comfy but a little short for average size person as leg would hang off the end. The room had air com which worked efficently. The bathroom was clean and big bath towels supplyed and changed everyday. I did have a little difficulty using the shower the temperture taps were on the wall oppisite the bath a shower and its was hard to regulate the temp of the water the showers was either too hot or too cold. There was a mini bar in the room which we took full advantage of. We were on the 4th floor and had 2 year old with us and didnt find the windows very secure you only had to flick handle and the window open wide very dangerous for children. The Pool And Bar Area It was clean and all bar staff very friendly all ready for a chat. The pool area quite small but never too crowed always some where to sit. The pool was suffient size but it wasnt heated and the water always very cold even after the sun had been on it all day. There were towels by the pool to use the put straight in th laundry bag provided. Breakfast Breakfast was betwwen 8 and 10.30 so need to rush in the morning, it was always well maintained nothing ever ran out what ever time you went. I would recommend the apple crossients had to have one every morning. Didnt eat dinner at hotel but the menu looked good but little expencive.
