Location Hotel situated about 5mins away from metro station and airport bus stops 5mins from hotel and only costs 4 euros. Les Ramble is 2 min away. I had pleasent experience staying at this hotel a would recommend it. It is suitable for anyone from families to honeymooners the girly weekends away.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disasterous”
Reviews.Author: ZLUV
Reviews.Content: We are pretty well-traveled and have stayed at a variety of hotels, B&Bs, etc from -5-star to basic. This by far was the worst hotel experience we've had. We checked into a room with a smelly bathroom, and stinky tile floor. The room was overall pretty run down, with old, scratched up paint on the walls, and old furniture. We couldn't sleep because of the offensive smell. So we complained and asked to be moved. They first offered to clean our room, which did not help with the smell. The room we were moved to was even WORSE, and SMALLER in size. We rejected that, threatened to move out, and were offered a third room. When we lied down in bed, we discovered BUGS crawling all over us. We catapulted out of bed, and out of that hotel. Checked into a nice boutique hotel (same price) 3 blocks away, and finally enjoyed Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: themilkybarkid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights to attend a conference - I was in room 527 at the front of the hotel. The room was a little small but had the benefit of a good sized balcony with table and chair great for chilling out, sunbathing enjoying a drink. No tea or coffee making facilities so if you fancy a drink take your own bottle opener and snacks! You could use the mini-bar in your room but I guess it's probably pretty expensive. The room has a decent bathroom with all you'd want. The room was serviced every day and left immaculate. What makes this hotel recommended is: 1. The Location - it's just off the Cataluyna Plaza which is the heart of all the transport links. The metro line is superb - buy a ticket with 20 journey's it's much cheaper. You can also get the airport bus direct from the Plaza. Just off the plaza is the famous La Ramblas. The Plaza and La Ramblas are very busy popular areas but this hotel is just off in what is surprisingly a quiet street. 2. The Breakfast (food and the service) - buffet eat as much as you like with a very wide range always kept in good supply, always tidied and kept neat. In fact the staff are just so attentive, warm and provide an excellent service. Topping up your coffee is no hassle someone is floating around all the time looking after you. The food is good quality. The freshly baked cakes and donuts are highly recommended! 3. The Pool - on the first floor there is an open air (small) swimming pool -surrounded by gardens, trees, shrubs with a good supply of chairs and sun bed. Towels provided too. This is a lovely relaxing haven from busy city life. 4. The Architecture - the hotel was designed by Gaudi's teacher - the doorwar and staircase has all the hallmarks. 5. The staff - all pleasant and helpful - especially breakfast staff. The only downside was that the aircon didn't seem to be working - so a huge vertical fan was installed in my room which was fine - left on too long air con leaves me with a dry throat. The room was a little small -but they are all different. But I'd recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We just loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BabyBlueTLV
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I enjoyed the stay. First of all, the location of the hotel is incredible. It is 2 minutes walk from the Catalonia Plaza (and I am one easy walker) and metro station, 3 minutes walk from one of the best tapas bars (Txapela, Passeig de Gracia 8), 5 minutes walk from the Ramblas. And still the hotel is very quite. The rooms are big and clean. The bathroom is clean and comfortable. Our room had a small balcony from which we could see the Catalonia Plaza. The stuff is very friendly. The lobby is beautiful. The breakfast is incredible (we started with couple of glasses of Cava each morning).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Barcelona tourism”
Reviews.Author: Massimo1
Reviews.Content: Duques de Bergara is a tourist and business hotel. Having been to Barcelona before, I chose this hotel for price and because it was close to Las Ramblas without actually being in the thick of it, and it was well-placed for seeing other districts as well. The hotel, while almost on the Plaza Catalunya, is amazingly on a quiet street. It is a few meters from plaza, just at the top of Las Ramblas, where several metro lines and the train converge. You can walk from the hotel to most of the major areas with the exception of Montjuic. A nice bonus was the rooftop pool and very pleasant bar, which made for a calming apres-tourism oasis. I had a double room looking on an airshaft, but that was not a worry. It meant no street noise. I wasn't in the room so much. The bed was really comfy, just soft enough to rest me well after long days of wandering around. The sheets were really high-quality, and I appreciated that. The room had climate control. My only disappointment is that the room seemed rather plain and under-decorated for this class of hotel. There was a separate door between the bedroom and the entry foyer. That was useful, as the hotel has marble floors and sounds echoed. The bathroom, off the foyer, was spacious with a full size tub and nice big towels, changed every day. However, the ceiling vent fan was not working. One thing I did not like, as this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel, is that they charge by the day to rent a lock for the in-room safe. That should just be part of the deal. The staff at the front desk was helpful for my needs. They have only one internet station in the lobby and it is terribly expensive. There are internet places down in the Las Ramblas areas for 1/10th the price. There is so much great food in Barcelona, yet one night I was lazy and ate at the hotel restaurant. It was excellent with fine service, not overpriced, and I would recommend at least one meal there. Breakfast, though expensive, is quite good, too. For outside meals, tapas is found everywhere. I recommend El Taller de Tapas, an upscale place for outstanding quality and preparation and a great winelist. I liked it so much, I went 2 nights in a row. There's one in the Eixample district and one in the Born district. This is their website, to help you find it: http://www.tallerdetapas.com/

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Jesstur
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews for this hotel weren't great and the poor quality photos of the interior led me to expect a very dated, slightly shabby hotel. However on arrival I was very pleasantly surprised - the location was superb - two steps of the Placa Catalunya and a minute from the airport bus stop and metro - the exterior building was beautiful, as was the entrance way. Once inside the staff were friendly and the room, particularly the bathroom, was a very good size with a balcony with a nice table and chairs overlooking the pool. Everything was very clean and presentable. Breakfast was an excellent selection served until 11am on the weekend (10.30am weekday) which suited us, although the food could have been a little hotter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: HolidaysForTwo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Barcelona. Like others I was concerned to read some of the reviews of the hotel but on arrival our fears were quickly allayed. We were welcomed by very friendly reception staff and were delighted with our room on the sixth floor - a really good sized room with double bed, small sitting area, mini bar with reasonably priced drinks, large marble tiled bathroom with shower and - best of all - a spacious terrace with seating which overlooked the rooftops. The room was also air-conditioned. The hotel is ideally situated just yards from Placa Catalunya and the top of La Rambla - all the tour buses leave from here and the nearest metro station is a couple of minutes walk. Despite being close to all the action the hotel is really quiet - very few cars pass by on street outside - it is really only for taxis dropping off and picking up - and so we had four nights of very peaceful sleep. Breakfasts were wonderful - an excellent range of hot and cold dishes and the most wonderful little pastries which were baked on the premises. The staff were so friendly and helpful and constantly ensured that there were sufficient supplies of everything and also walked round topping up coffees. A lovely light dining area with quiet music in the background ensured that we had a really nice start to the day - plus a little glass of the cava that was available was also a nice little luxury! We made use of the bar on a couple of the evenings and the barman was delightful - couldn't have been more helpful and was so friendly. Also on the day of our departure the reception staff were really helpful - storing our luggage while we had a last walk before leaving for our flight - and then calling a taxi and taking our luggage out - special thanks to the really friendly bellboy. I could not recommend this hotel more highly - it really contributed so much to our first visit to Barcelona - and I would have no hesitation in returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Caramel4
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews for this hotel but I needn't have worried. We had two rooms on the 5th floor and both were clean and in good condition. The triple glazing ensured there was no noise from the traffic. We found all the staff pleasant and helpful. The location is excellent - close to the Placa Catalunya and the Ramblas but set on a quiet side street. We had breakfast as part of our package and really enjoyed it - I really enjoyed the doughnuts and little lemon cakes. We found it kept us going all day until the evening. I would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “really convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off the main square of placa de catalonia where all the transport from and to the airport comes into. It is at the top of la rambla, which is very convenient for walking. My husband and i stayed there for 5 nights and found the hotel in great condition. Staff on reception very friendly and helpful. Swimming pool aswell but had no time to use it but looked clean and tidy. Nice calm modern bar area on first floor. Looked at menu in restaurant but was very expensive and didnt look to have much atmosphere but probably because not too many diners because of price. Try not to be too seduced by eating on la rambla cos a lot of the restaurants are poor but with high prices!! The Attic was an exception! The food was of a high standard and a good price aswell so obviously with that you have to queue usually around half an hour but only found out on our night home that we could have booked and not had the wait. SO BOOK!! Also 'le quatre gats' was very good and very authentic bohemian style interior. I had the monkkfish and it was cooked perfectly. A little pretentious i suppose but good value 3 course and bottle of wine for around £60!! All menus in english so no embarassment. The beach from this hotel is about a 25-30 min walk down la rambla and to the left but you can take a metro just outside hotel. It was very clean but too many massage women constantly looking to massage you on beach. I must have been asked about 10 times one afternoon, i even pretended to be asleep but they tried to wake me!! Watch out for pick pockets cos la rambla is very very busy...nearly as busy as oxford st at christmas!! but very entertaining with street performances. Barcelona is a great city for culture and relaxation and i would definitely recommend this hotel and the city to visit..oh great shopping too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby and location Everything else not good”
Reviews.Author: Imnerd
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful and you are a block away from Las Ramblas. Other than that I would not stay here. There are 4 of us (two adults two children) and we booked a room for 4 and received a room for 3. They were not accomadating and had a take it or leave it atitude. The room had a musty smell. The front desk was rude. The pool area was small and dirty. This was our last stop in Spain (Madrid, Seville, Marbella) and all other hotels were great (Hotel Emperador in Madrid, Hotel Ingleterra in Seville and Marriott Vacation Club in Marbella). This place was bad. Barcelona is a beautiful city with great attractions, great food and a wonderful atmosphere. The people are wonderful other than at this hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “7 lad City Break”
Reviews.Author: AUSTINO
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for lads weekend, great location literally yards from La Rambla and Metro station. Stayed in room 206 second floor room looked out onto main street but no problem of noise as double doors on verander. Room was cleaned every day, mini bar priced reasonably cheap $3 euros for the small bottles of Fanta, coke, and $12 euros for the small bottle of Cava. Breakfast was open till 11 every morning while we were there, didn't have any problems with the food, continental stuff wide selection of meats, cheese etc, for all you englanders they had proper bacon and real sausages all be it small ones decent scramble egg and fried eggs on bread. The pool area was cool. but wouldn't like to have one of the rooms on the first floor that leads to the bar I think its rooms 117 - 125 can imagine it gets loud if people are going to the bar at night, but hotel seemed to be quite empty. Marco the italian bar man was nice. Great location would defo recommend didn't have any problems with pick pockets outside hotel but can't see anyone messing with 5 scousers and 2 well spoken southerners !! So good for big parties and couples as the bar area had couches and quite areas surrounding it. central to everywhere defo worth £50 a night for a few days at least. if anyone would like to ask any specific questions drop me a line.

Reviews.Title: “WORST BREAKFAST WORLDWIDE”
Reviews.Author: Julyaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: We just spent some happy days in the beautiful and enjoyable city of Barcelona. The hotel is walking distance from Plaza Catalunya and there you can take the underground which takes you anywhere. Careful with the thiefs at las Ramblas and even at the Hotel Lobby. This place, which is as central as it can be contains the best and the worst of what you would expect at a Hotel. In fact no queries would have been found if we had not have breakfast the last day of our stay in which we had to suffer how baddly the staff could be trated by the Restaurant's manager. We were having breakfast and that person which was supposed to be in charge (Giseppe) shouted, and apparently tried to be laughing of his own staff. That was really embarasing for us because the service was being very friendly and kind. In fact the service provided by Giseppe was nasty and seemed to be a favour. A favour that was not for free, of course. Disgusting. Rude. Avoid breakfast and your stay will be as enjoyable as ours should have been.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shwcci
Reviews.Content: Great Location for exploring the city. The Lobby was very pretty and the room was large and clean although very simple. We had a small sitting area with a couch. Only problem was that our room was situated right next to the stair tower on the top floor and since the stairs are open from the top floor to the bottom you could hear an awful lot of noise. Service was friendly, they originally gave us a room with two twins but we wanted a double bed and they were very accomodating, allowing us to check in early. Nice pool area in the courtyard. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: westchez3
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at hotel for 3 nights from 27-30th Jan 07. The hotel is most definately a 4* establishment, it is stunning inside, very ornamental and my pictures do not do it justice. The room was very well equiped and spotless. The location is 5* 50 metres to the main Catalyuna Square and same to the La Ramblas area. The breakfast was excellent, good fresh selection a mixture of continental and britsh. Staff were friendly and at all times attentive. We went on the bus tours which were excellent 23 euros for two days hop on off. It is the best way to see everything in a few days. We also ate in a lovely restaurant, in Placa Real on the ramblas. The name translates into 15 nights. This was so popular, no other restaurant hada queue in the sqaure, in Jan. The average cost for 2 drinks and two courses for us was 30 euros in total.

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: PWF
Reviews.Content: 15 of us on a football trip stayed here over a weekend in November. To be honest it wasn't the first choice but other hotels were not prepared to take 15 (ageing) blokes - their loss. However, top marks to the Duques de Bergara. Location perfect, next to Place de Catalunya and metro station. Rooms were generally sapcious, clean, modern, with good washing facilities and toiletries provided. And (important for us) twin rooms meant twin rooms (not doubles !). Staff were friendly and polite, and (minor point) there was an endless supply of fruity sweets at reception. Breakfast outstanding - continental and English. Considering what we paid, real value for money. As for Barca, glorious sunshine, plenty to see, cheap beer and food at Cafe Zurich (1 minute away from the hotel). As the guide books tell you, don't stray off La Ramblas at night and if you want an alternative to the Nou Camp, try the Olympic Stadium (fantastic views of the city and beyond) and watch Espanyol. Quality hotel, quality city.
